Articles.Content: What does stock-alike and FASA mean/stand for? Are these just names of mod suites?

Stock-alike just means the mod has an appearance similar to stock parts, and possibly similar performance.

FASA is a mod itself.

Stock-alike is a blanket term applied to mods that are "like stock", in the sense that they share the same art style and general feel of the stock game (without any mods)

FASA is a part mod that adds parts similar to that of real-life NASA rockets, which can be downloaded here.

3 minutes ago, Wcmille said:

What does stock-alike and FASA mean/stand for? Are these just names of mod suites?

Stock-alike simply means that the parts have a similar look and feel to stock, and FASA is basically a gigantic kerbal NASA mod.
Mod question moved to the mod subforum.
